title: AAQ: How can lust be utilized in serving the Lord | HG Madhu Pandit Dasa
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: So, in Bhakti Yoga, it is suggested like we can engage our lust, anger, greed to serve the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of utilizing lust, anger, and greed in the service of the Lord within Bhakti Yoga.
segments.transcript: So, in this material world, lust is considered a perverted reflection of love. So, in Bhakti Yoga, it is suggested that we can engage our lust, anger, and greed to serve the Lord.

segments.key_quote: When they are engaged in service of the Lord by a conditioned soul, it gets purified.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how material lust and anger can be purified through engagement in the service of the Lord, leading to freedom from these desires.
segments.transcript: So, then how is this lust serving the Lord in the spiritual world? If the order of the Lord is there, He will purify it. Just like Krishna says, "I am sex life according to regulative principles." So, even though, that means it is a compromise. When material lust, material anger, material all these things are engaged in the service of the Lord by a conditioned soul, it gets purified. That means you become free from that lust. You become free from that anger.

segments.key_quote: That anger is coming out of his pure Bhakti.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the anger of a conditioned soul with the anger of a pure devotee, using Hanuman as an example, emphasizing that the latter stems from pure Bhakti.
segments.transcript: So, this is different from pure devotees. An awakened person, he can also be angry. Hanuman was angry. That anger is not doubt-telling anger. That anger is coming out of his pure Bhakti.

segments.key_quote: but if you know the real purpose you can use that to untrap also
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the freedom of pure devotees from lust and how divine forces, including sex, can be used to liberate oneself if one understands their true purpose.
segments.transcript: You understand? So that is different. A pure devotee's anger, everything is different. Of course, they are free from lust. Even like Bhaktivinoda Thakur says that if I can—but you know, Thakur or Bhaktis is not—but this is not so. If I can bring forth hundreds of pure devotees, I won't mind engaging in sex. Divine forces Krishna has made that to trap the living entities, correct? But if you know the real purpose, you can use that to untrap also.
